common.title: Clean and Prepare Enclosure
common.description: Thoroughly clean enclosure with reptile-safe disinfectant. Rinse well and let dry completely.

bioactive.title: Install Drainage Layer
bioactive.description: Add LECA or clay balls to create drainage layer. Level carefully.

bioactive.title: Add Drainage Barrier
bioactive.description: Cut mesh screen to size and place over drainage layer. Ensure complete coverage.

bioactive.title: Add Substrate
bioactive.description: Add bioactive substrate mix. Create slight slope from back to front for drainage. Lightly moisten.

simple.title: Add Substrate
simple.description: Add substrate layer. Ensure even depth across enclosure floor.

shared.title: Install Background (Optional)
shared.description: If using foam background or cork bark backing, install before adding branches.

shared.title: Add Hardscape and Branches
shared.description: Install climbing branches at various angles. Ensure stability - test that branches don't shift.

shared.title: Install Water Feature
shared.description: Place water dish or bowl in easily accessible location. Ensure it's stable and won't tip. For arboreal species, consider elevated water stations.

shared.title: Position Hides
shared.description: Place hides in both warm and cool zones. Ensure entrances are appropriately sized. Add leaf litter or plants for additional security.

shared.title: Add Plants and Decor
shared.description: Place plants (live or artificial). Create visual barriers and hiding spots. Leave clear paths for animal movement.

shared.title: Set Up Feeding Station
shared.description: Designate feeding area - elevated ledge for arboreal species, open ground area for terrestrial. Ensure easy access for both animal and keeper.

bioactiveCleanupCrew.title: Add Cleanup Crew
bioactiveCleanupCrew.description: Introduce springtails and isopods. Let them establish for 2-3 weeks before adding animal.

final.title: Install Lighting and Heating
final.description: Mount UVB fixture and heat lamp on screen top. Position basking lamp over designated zone.

final.title: Set Up Timers
final.description: Connect lights to programmable timers. Set appropriate photoperiod (typically 12h on/12h off). Verify timers are functioning correctly.

final.title: Organize Cables and Power
final.description: Route cables safely away from moisture. Use power strip with surge protection. Keep cables organized and away from animal access. Label all cords.

final.title: Secure All Equipment
final.description: Double-check that heat lamps are clamped securely. Verify screen fits tightly with no gaps. Ensure no equipment can fall into enclosure.

final.title: Add Monitoring Equipment
final.description: Place thermometer probes in basking and cool zones. Position hygrometer at mid-height.

final.title: Test Misting/Humidity System
final.description: If using misting system, test spray coverage and drainage. Set appropriate misting schedule on timer. Verify substrate isn't getting waterlogged.

final.title: Test and Adjust Parameters
final.description: Run enclosure for 48-72 hours without animal. Monitor temps and humidity. Adjust lighting height, wattage, and misting schedule as needed.

final.title: Escape-Proof Enclosure
final.description: Check all gaps, seams, and door closures. Verify screen is secure with no tears. Test door latches multiple times. Seal any gaps larger than 1/4 inch.

final.title: Final Check
final.description: Verify all parameters are stable. Check for any sharp edges or hazards. Ensure all equipment is secure and functioning.

final.title: Introduce Animal
final.description: Place animal in enclosure during evening hours. Minimize handling. Do not feed for 24-48 hours to reduce stress.
